alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued November 30 at 2:43AM MST until December 02 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Southwest winds 30 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph possible. * WHERE...Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County, North Snowy Range Foothills and South Laramie Range. * WHEN...From this evening through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. There will be a high risk for vehicle blow overs, particularly along north to south oriented roadways.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range
